definition: not having anything at all (idiom); utterly lacking/without two sticks to rub together
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: I had noting in the world but a million-pound note.
sentences.chinese: 除了一张百万英磅的钞票外，我一无所有。

sentences.english: God's axes of trial have stripped and bared them.
sentences.chinese: 神的斧子将我们剥夺得一无所有。

sentences.english: Nothing is a treasure, it makes the poor have the impulse to change destiny.
sentences.chinese: 一无所有是一种财富，它让穷人产生改变命运的冲动。

sentences.english: A man of business may talk of philosophy, a man who has none may practice it.
sentences.chinese: 商人也许会谈谈哲学，而一无所有者也许会施诸实践。

sentences.english: All they had were memories of the days when God's favor was on them.
sentences.chinese: 他们一无所有，只剩下上帝向他们施恩时的回忆。

sentences.english: When winter came, the grasshopper had nothing, but the ant complained of chest pains.
sentences.chinese: 到了冬天，蚱蜢一无所有，可是蚂蚁却喊胸口疼。

sentences.english: I arrived in this country with zilch.
sentences.chinese: 我来到这个国家时身上一无所有。

sentences.english: I'm Miss. Longly. I have nobody.
sentences.chinese: 我是单身女士，孤独地，一无所有。

sentences.english: The starkness of their living conditions shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 他们的生活条件一无所有，他感到十分震惊。

sentences.english: Apart from clothes and bedding, I have nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我除了行李被褥之外一无所有。

sentences.english: I had nothing in the world but a million-pound note.
sentences.chinese: 除了一张一百万英镑的钞票外，我是一无所有。

sentences.english: If you have nothing to lose, you can try everything.
sentences.chinese: 如果你一无所有，反而可以放手去做。
除了一片废墟外一无所有了。

sentences.english: Compared with holes, has nothing to more unfortunate.
sentences.chinese: 比起千疮百孔，一无所有才更加不幸。

sentences.english: Now there is nothing but time.
sentences.chinese: 现在除了时间我一无所有。

definition: to be penniless
penniless
to be all alone in the world
without a penny to one's name/penniless/stony-broke
poor wretch/pauper/destitute man/poverty-stricken peasant/penniless good-for-nothing/impecunious vagabond
penniless (idiom)
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
not having any special skill/without any qualifications
deep in debt
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
disappointed/frustrated/dejected
to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
to win success and recognition (idiom)
poverty stricken
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
